original_content:
3D printed materials have come a long way in the last decade or so as printers have become more and more mainstream. Printers can use all kinds of different plastics with varying physical characteristics, and there are even printers now for other materials like concrete and metal. But even staying within the realm of the plastic printer can do a lot of jobs you might not expect. [Camden Bowen] recently 3D printed a single-piston engine which nearly worked, and is back with some improvements to it thanks to a small carburetor.
The carburetor itself isnt 3D printed (although not from lack of trying)  its on loan from a weed eater, and is helping to solve a problem with the fuel-air mixture of his original design. Switching from butane to a liquid fuel also solved some problems as well, and using starter fluid also helped to kick off the ignition. Although it ran for a short period of time over several starts, the valve train suffered some damage with the exhaust valves melting in place to the head. This is actually a problem common to any internal combustion engine like this, especially if the fuel-air mixture is too lean, theres incomplete combustion, the valves arent adjusted properly, or any number of other problems. In this case it seems to have been caused by improper engine timing.
Its actually noteworthy though that the intake valves werent burned, meaning that if the engine can be tuned to allow for complete combustion before the exhaust gasses leave the combustion chamber, the plastic 3D printed head and valve train will likely survive much longer operational periods. Well certainly look forward to the next iteration of this engine build to see if thats the case. If 3D printed piston engines arent your speed, though, take a look at this jet engine which uses a 3D printed compressor.


Thanks to [Rickert] for the tip!
title: 3Dプリント技術を用いた単気筒エンジンの試作品が開発される
body:
プラスチック3Dプリントされた単気筒エンジンがほぼ動いたが、改良のために小型キャブレターを取り付けることになった。コンクリートや金属など他の材料で使える3Dプリンタもある。燃料を液体に変更すると問題も解決し、始動液も点火に役立った。バルブのタイミングが不適切だったため、エキゾーストバルブが溶けて損傷した。しかし、完全燃焼が可能になればプラスチック製のヘッドとバルブトレーンは長持ちする可能性もある。次のバージョンに期待。
（284文字）
titles: 3Dプリント技術を用いた単気筒エンジンの試作品が開発される
ウィードイーターから借りたキャブレターが3Dプリントエンジンの問題を解決
液体燃料の使用により3Dプリントエンジンの燃料混合問題が解消される
3Dプリントエンジンの次回バージョンが期待される
3Dプリント技術を使用したジェットエンジンの紹介
